definition: not one good point/everything about it is wrong
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
is/are/am/yes/to be
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish

sentences.english: If nothing else though, it gave us the honey scene.
sentences.chinese: 儘管其他一無是處，但它給我們帶來了甜蜜的場景。

sentences.english: The Knesset has been debased by the executive's greater clout.
sentences.chinese: 而國會也在執政官的更大的影響下被貶的一無是處。

sentences.english: You can't be a basketcase, a girl who causes a scene or a girl who drinks too much.
sentences.chinese: 你不能一無是處，只知道大吵大鬧或喝得爛醉。

sentences.english: The young men had nothing better to do than fracas in the streets.
sentences.chinese: 這個年輕人除了在街上吵鬧，一無是處。

sentences.english: The film was rubbished by the critics.
sentences.chinese: 影評家把這部影片貶得一無是處。

sentences.english: They thought I was an otaku and good for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 例句他們覺得我就是個御宅男，一無是處。

sentences.english: I find it close to useless for everyone except HR.
sentences.chinese: 我發現它對於大家來說都近乎一無是處，除了人力部。

sentences.english: He rubbished most of the novels written by contemporary writers.
sentences.chinese: 他把大多數當代作家寫的小說貶得一無是處。

sentences.english: The new editor picked her manuscript to pieces.
sentences.chinese: 新編輯把她的原稿批得一無是處。

sentences.english: These new smartphone platforms are nothing without a capable AppStore.
sentences.chinese: 這些智能手機平臺如果沒有應用程序存儲則一無是處。

sentences.english: We (USA) are now in a position of impotency, only complaining and nibbling around the edges withfeble sanctions.
sentences.chinese: 我們美國現在一無是處，只會抱怨和實施一些小制裁。

sentences.english: Her father was dead set against her marrying that no-good Fitch.
sentences.chinese: 她父親堅決反對她嫁給那個一無是處的菲奇。

sentences.english: I consider that their claims are worthless.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲，他們的調查一無是處。

sentences.english: It was about time that Jessica got rid of that no-good boyfriend!
sentences.chinese: 也該是潔西卡甩掉一無是處的男友的時候了。

sentences.english: Early winter on the merit it?
Her boyfriend is a good - for - nothing layabout.
sentences.chinese: 她的男友是一個一無是處的懶漢。

definition: to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
self-taught/to learn without a teacher (idiom)
to play deaf-mute
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to force someone to do something
hard power (i.e. military and economic power)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
to be chivalrous
to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
